title: Improving Speech Enhancement by Cross- and Sub-band Processing with State Space Model
author: Jizhen Li (NERCMS, Wuhan University), Weiping Tu (NERCMS, Wuhan University), Yuhong Yang (NERCMS, Wuhan University), Xinmeng Xu (NERCMS, Wuhan University), Yiqun Zhang (NERCMS, Wuhan University), Yanzhen Ren (Wuhan University), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces novel techniques in speech enhancement, specifically through sub-band processing and restoration, which align closely with Haohe Liu's work in audio quality enhancement and speech restoration.
background: The task involves improving the clarity and intelligibility of speech signals affected by various environmental noises using advanced model architectures.
contribution: This paper introduces Cross- and Sub-band Mamba (CSMamba) to solve limitations in conventional speech enhancement models, achieving superior performance on the DNS Challenge 2021 dataset.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like Transformer-based and RNN-based solutions have limitations in computational complexity and memory capacity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing a flexible band split method and independent processing for different sub-bands, enhancing overall model robustness and detail recovery.

key_innovation: Introduces a band split block that processes sub-bands with independent convolutional weights and utilizes a spectrum restoration block to enhance high-frequency details.
real_world_impact: This research may significantly enhance applications like hearing aids and automatic speech recognition by improving speech clarity in noisy environments.

new_terms.Cross- and Sub-band Mamba (CSMamba): **CSMamba** refers to the proposed model enhancing speech quality by flexibly processing sub-bands and managing inter-band information.
new_terms.band split block: **Band split block** is a processing module that divides a full-band audio signal into distinct sub-bands to optimize feature extraction.
